numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a significant portion of Indonesians in both age groups.
2. These Indonesians think that the world is getting better with each generation.
4. In each of these countries, a majority of people who are 40 years old or older think that the world is getting better with each generation.
5. All of these countries are in Africa or in Asia.
6. South Asia is a part of Asia.
7. Some of these countries are in South Asia.
9. The survey asked a question about whether the world is getting better with each generation.
10. I wonder what factors the surveyed people considered when they answered the question.
11. Different countries have different economic situations.
12. Different countries have different social situations.
13. Different countries have different political situations.
14. I wonder if people in different countries considered different things based on these situations.
15. This relates to me and my community.
16. My generation is making a lot of change for future generations.
17. My generation is trying to make a lot of change for future generations.
18. The headline is: How wonderful is the world? Two generations weigh in.
